item.title: Graffiti Morrisons Black Acoustic fencing, 6th January
item.description:
1) Graffiti on Morrisons Black Acoustic fencing (which surrounds the delivery truck bay) was reported on 2nd January under reference FixMyStreet ref: 8615832. Today I received an update to say that it was FIXED. IT HAS NOT BEEN FIXED NOR REMOVED AND THE GRAFFITI, MAFIOSO, NOSE, LOOT MALDOG remain in large and vivid view. Could this please be removed ASAP. 2) Also reported on 2nd January under reference: FixMyStreet ref: 8615826 is the same graffiti MAFIOSO, NOSE, LOOT MALDOG on both sides of Daneville Road from Denmark Hill all the way to Grove Lane. It’s on lamp posts, brickwork, trees and walls. Could this be removed ASAP too. Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Daneville Road, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large deep pothole in middle of the road, 6th January
item.description:
Already noted on Epping Councils site. Large, deep pothole in the middle of the road. This is just by the small bridge that goes over Cobbins Brook and just before the width restriction, priority passing signs.

item.title: “This litter bin keeps being missed, and it needs to be checked more times each week.”, 6th January
item.description:
Urgent Concern: Waste Management Issues on King Hall Road Alleyway I am writing to raise an urgent concern regarding the waste management in the alleyway adjacent to 79 King Hall Road, which leads up to Clock House Station. The refuse bin in this location is frequently overflowing, resulting in widespread litter and attracting vermin such as rats and foxes. This poses serious health and hygiene risks to residents and pedestrians, including the potential spread of bacteria, unpleasant odours, and increased risk of slips or injuries due to scattered waste. It appears that this area is consistently overlooked during routine collections. To mitigate these risks and maintain public hygiene, I strongly recommend that waste collection in this alleyway be scheduled at least four times a week. I urge the relevant team to investigate this matter promptly and implement a sustainable solution to ensure regular maintenance and cleanliness. Thank you for your attention to this matter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 170, High Street, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ice across whole pavement, v dangerous, 6th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parish Lane, Penge, Greater London
